                                      |
                                      +--ft.Stepper
public class Stepper
extends StepMotor

influences and displays the state of a motor. Digital inputs define home and track current position.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

Stepper

public Stepper(Interface iface,
               int motor,
               java.lang.String motorText,
               int home,
               java.lang.String homeText,
               int toHome,
               int step,
               java.lang.String stepText,
               int maxStep)
initialize to off, arm labels for mouse events.
Parameters:
iface - to observe and set motor state.
motor - M1.. for motor to be observed.
motorText - to be displayed in component; null to suppress.
home - E1.. for input defining home position.
homeText - to be displayed in component; null to suppress.
toHome - LEFT/RIGHT to move to home position.
step - E1.. for input counting current position.
stepText - to be displayed in component; null to suppress.
maxStep - maximum count, 0 unlimited.
Method Detail

home

public void home()
home the motor. this is notified once it is no longer running.

position

public void position(int goal)
position the motor. this is notified once it is no longer running.

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
motor's state.
